definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他兴致勃勃地揭发政敌的贪污腐化。

sentences.english: Many believe that children are corrupted by their elders' vices.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为，小孩子被他们长辈的劣行所腐化。

sentences.english: With convincing power he portrayed the usurpation and corruptions of the papal see.
sentences.chinese: 他有力地抨击罗马教廷僭越权限和腐化败坏的行为。

sentences.english: In both cases, the roots are rotten and the sources poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 两者皆是根的腐化与源的毒化。

sentences.english: Courtesy these greedy Corrupt all Political leaders from all parties, headed by Congress.
sentences.chinese: 以国会为首的各党派政治领导人贪婪腐化使然。

sentences.english: These government officials led a dissipated life and have all been subjected to the punishment they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 这些贪污腐化的官员都受到了应有的制裁。

sentences.english: I can read books instead of watching mind-rotting television, for instance.
sentences.chinese: 比如，我可以用读书代替腐化人思想的电视。

sentences.english: Who rejoice in doing evil and delight in the perverseness of evil.
sentences.chinese: 那些对制作罪恶觉得欣忧的人，也为罪恶腐化而高兴。

sentences.english: We, as their seed, inherited a corruptible and mortal nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们，因为他们的种子，继承了腐化和致命性的。

sentences.english: The cities make ferocious men because they make corrupt men.
sentences.chinese: 城市会使人变得凶残，因为它使人腐化堕落。

sentences.english: The young reporter muckrakes at every opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的记者不放过揭发贪污腐化现象的任何机会。

sentences.english: Soc. Could we live, having an evil and corrupted body?
sentences.chinese: 我们可以活着拥有一个邪恶和腐化的身体吗？

sentences.english: That's why death is still uncorrupted.
sentences.chinese: 那是死还未被腐化的理由。

sentences.english: The corrupt mayor should be removed from office and prosecuted.
sentences.chinese: 这个腐化堕落的市长应当撤职查办。

sentences.english: For instance, fossilized dung, or "coprolites, " have revealed some dinosaurs ate grass.
sentences.chinese: 例如，腐化粪便，或“粪化石”揭示了些恐龙食草。

definition: to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
(of insects) to undergo metamorphosis/(fig.) to be transformed/to metamorphose/to become degraded
insect that eats into wood, books, clothes etc/fig. vermin
